subject: Re: [junit] Re: Will JUnit 'fail()' trip up ALL code coverage tools?
msgSnippet: ... I have a junit-based web testing framework that comes with a selection of pre-written configurable tests along with pluggable extension mechanism. I have
messageBody:
On 27/09/05, Jim McMaster <jim.mcmaster@...> wrote:
>
> Just curious...do you also write tests to test the code that tests the
> tests? If so, when do you stop?
>
>
> --
> Jim McMaster
> mailto:jim.mcmaster@...
>
>
I have a junit-based web testing framework that comes with a selection of
pre-written configurable tests along with pluggable extension mechanism. I
have written tests for certain aspects of the redistributable tests -
notably the configuration part, but it does get a little circular in your
head!

James


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
